summary: The U.S. Coast Guard plans to spend over $17 billion to acquire 25 Offshore Patrol Cutters—ships that conduct search and rescue operations, among other missions. Two shipbuilders have started building the ships before completing design. Building ships with incomplete designs is risky. The first shipbuilder repeatedly faced costly rework and delayed deliveries, leading the Coast Guard to cancel half the ships on the contract. To...
title: Offshore Patrol Cutter: Coast Guard Should Gain Key Knowledge Before Buying More Ships
